Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Surgical Ventricular Reconstruction in Ischemic Heart Failure

Trial_Design.evidence: In this randomised controlled trial, 1000 patients with ischemic heart failure were randomised

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive either CABG alone or CABG plus SVR

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was survival, measured at 4 months postoperatively

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not applicable due to the nature of the interventions

Number_Randomised.evidence: 1000 patients with ischemic heart failure were randomised

Result_Outcome.evidence: SVR improved survival compared to CABG alone when the postoperative end-systolic volume index was ≤70 mL/m²

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse events were reported
